title: Analysis of Cars
text:
Letâ€™s investigate the relationship between fuel efficiency (mpg) and engine displacement (disp) from the mtcars dataset. Those variables have a correlation of r cor(mtcars$mpg, mtcars$disp) |> format(digits=2).


Here is a plot:

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load mtcars dataset
mtcars = sns.load_dataset('mpg').dropna()

# Calculate displacement from horsepower and cylinders (approximate if mtcars isn't available)
# But here we use seaborn's mpg dataset which has similar variables

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 5))
sns.scatterplot(data=mtcars, x='mpg', y='displacement', color='dodgerblue')
plt.title("MPG vs Displacement")
plt.xlabel("Miles Per Gallon (mpg)")
plt.ylabel("Engine Displacement")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Analysis of Cars
text:
Here is a plot:

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load mtcars dataset
mtcars = sns.load_dataset('mpg').dropna()

# Calculate displacement from horsepower and cylinders (approximate if mtcars isn't available)
# But here we use seaborn's mpg dataset which has similar variables

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 5))
sns.scatterplot(data=mtcars, x='mpg', y='displacement', color='dodgerblue')
plt.title("MPG vs Displacement")
plt.xlabel("Miles Per Gallon (mpg)")
plt.ylabel("Engine Displacement")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
